title: (None, '', u'nilearn/datasets/tests/test_func.py')

text:
Interesting "fix", is that autopep8 doing it? Arguably a better one would be to use `# ######` i.e. a space after the first hash.

Full disclosure, that may be just me but I am not a massive fan of these separating lines.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/plotting/tests/test_displays.py')

text:
so I discovered something the other day, PEP8 doesn't require you to have a space around binary operators. See [this](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#other-recommendations) for example.

Interestingly, autopep8 fixes something that pep8 doesn't see as a violation ...
title: (5, '', u'nilearn/tests/test_extmath.py')
